title: The Curse of Fenric
dialogue_triumphs: Ace in smug mode: 'And the half-time score: Perivale, six hundred million; Rest of the Universe, nil!'

Ace and a squaddie in a surreal conversation: 'Have to move faster than that if you want to keep up with me. Faster than light.' 'Faster than a second hand on a watch?' 'We're hardly moving yet… Sometimes I travel so fast I don't exist.'
goofs: Nobody in 1943 would know of Jane Russell, and there wouldn't be any road signs.
Wainwright's quotation from the Bible is unusual, being an 'edited' section from the Authorized Version with the more modern translation 'love' in place of the AV's 'charity'.
The Doctor cleans his muddy hand very quickly in episode four.
The Russians speak nothing but English after the first sequence, even to the point of death.
The Russians expect to get away with the huge Ultima machine in their little dinghy.
The English captain is surprisingly ready to join forces with the Russians he was trying to execute only hours before.

continuity_notes.name: Fenric
continuity_notes.description: An ancient evil created at the dawn of time, named by Vikings. Defeated by the Doctor in third-century Constantinople and imprisoned in a flask for seventeen centuries.

continuity_notes.name: Haemovores
continuity_notes.description: Future evolution of mankind, can only be destroyed by faith and cannot be harmed by objects alone.

continuity_notes.name: Ace
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's companion, descendant of Fenric's 'wolves'.
continuity_notes.current_status: Traveling with the Doctor, coming to terms with her past

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: Time Lord protagonist, ambidextrous and capable of forging official documents.

locations.name: Navy base near Whitby, Yorkshire
locations.description: Setting of the story, towards the end of the Second World War

future_history: The Doctor describes a potential future where Earth is 'rotting in chemical slime' after 'half a million years of industrial progress', leading to the evolution of haemovores.
untold_adventures: The Doctor's encounter with Fenric in third-century Constantinople
The Doctor's meeting with the Ancient One in the far future
additional_notes: The Soviets carry Simonov SKS rifles, which were developed during 1942.
bottom_line: 'The Curse of Fenric' includes many magical scenes: Sorin's faith in the Revolution, Ace's ignorance of 1940s morality when asking Kathleen if she is married, her argument with the Doctor over his manipulation of others, the moment of maturity when she declares: 'I'm not a little girl any more.' This is something special.
